dataset_name_title: Arts For Transit - Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) Permanent Art Catalogue
description: Provides a catalog of the various artwork located at train and subway stations throughout the metropolitan area under the MTA's Permanent Art Program.
Provides the locations of authorized businesses that can sell E-ZPass tags.

dataset_name_title: Eye On The Future - Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) Contract Solicitations
description: This dataset contains information for prospective contractors, engineers, architects, and vendors about contracts that are expected to be advertised for bids during specific time periods by the MTA's operating agencies.

dataset_name_title: Fare Card History for Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA): Beginning 2010
description: Provides detailed data on subway and bus fares collected by both the MetroCard and OMNY systems, including number of MetroCard swipes made each week by customers entering each station of the New York City Subway, PATH, AirTrain JFK. and the Roosevelt Island Tram, broken out to show the usage of the various types of MetroCards.
plan_submission_date_notes: Dataset will likely be retired as the hourly ridership datasets are improved to contain this information. This is tentatively scheduled to occur in Q4 2023.

dataset_name_title: Hourly Traffic on Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) Bridges and Tunnels: Beginning 2010
description: Reflects the number of vehicles (including cars, buses, trucks, and motorcycles) that pass through each of the bridges and tunnels operated by the MTA each hour of the day.

dataset_name_title: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) Capital Dashboard Agencies Detail
description: Provides information about the projects in the MTA’s 2010-2014 and 2005–2009 Capital Programs. The data describes the planned projects and provides information about the status of Project Budgets, Scopes, and Schedules, organized at the agency level.

dataset_name_title: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) Capital Dashboard Agencies Summary - All Load Dates
description: Provides information about the projects in the MTA’s 2010-2014 and 2005–2009 Capital Programs. The data describes the planned projects and provides information about the status of Project Budgets, Scopes, and Schedules.

dataset_name_title: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) Capital Dashboard Project Locations
description: Provides information about the projects in the MTA’s Capital Programs. The data describes the planned projects and provides information about the status of Project Budgets, Scopes and Schedules, as well as the geo-coordinates, where applicable, for Capital Projects.

This dataset provides subway ridership, compiled at the hourly level, by station complex, split by OMNY and MetroCard payment methods. These ridership metrics may differ slightly, but are within 1% of ridership figures provided at public MTA board meetings. Data is released on a weekly cadence and is subject to revision. You can learn more about OMNY, the contactless fare payment system for public transportation in the New York region here.
plan_submission_date_notes: Dataset successfully published in Q2 2023. Multiple enhancements planned in Q3 and Q4 of 2023.

description: Contains information about areas of customer service and how that service was rated, based on public correspondence to the MTA about complaints or commendations in a variety of categories.
Provides location data where Transit Wireless Wi-Fi access is available in the subway system.

dataset_name_title: NYC Transit Subway Entrance And Exit Data
description: Provides a variety of information on subway station entrances and exits, including Division, Line, Station Name, Longitude and Latitude coordinates, and more.
Contains information on subway entry/exit register values for individual control areas in the year 2014.
Contains information on subway entry/exit register values for individual control areas in the year 2014.

Reflects the number of units vandalized for select elements of the subway and bus system.

Presents Access-A-Ride ridership measured both as total trips (the count of trips provided to registered Access-A-Ride clients) and total ridership (the count of personal care attendants (PCAs) and guests who join clients on the trips).

dataset_name_title: Subway Elevator and Escalator asset and service status feeds
description: Provides information about planned and real-time elevators and escalator outages in the NYC subway system.
plan_submission_date_notes: Delayed while determining how to best link to real-time feeds.

description: This dataset provides bus ridership, compiled at the hourly level, split by OMNY and MetroCard payment methods. These ridership metrics may differ slightly but are within 1% of ridership figures provided at public MTA board meetings. Data is released on a weekly cadence and is subject to revision. You can learn more about OMNY, the contactless fare payment system for public transportation in the New York region here.
plan_submission_date_notes: Dataset successfully published in Q2 2023. Multiple enhancements planned in Q3 and Q4 of 2023.

description: This dataset provides the official MTA colors by line and toll method.
plan_submission_date_notes: Dataset release moved from Q2 2023 to Q3 2023 by request of the data owner.

description: Contains information on subway entry/exit register values for individual control areas in the year 2014.

dataset_name_title: MTA General Transit Feed Specification (GTFS) Static Data
description: Presents schedules and associated data (including station / bus stop locations, train lines, and bus routes) for NYCT Subway, NYCT Bus, MTA Bus, LIRR, and Metro-North in GTFS Static format.

dataset_name_title: Real-time service and service alert feeds (GTFS-realtime, SIRI, JSON)
description: Provides real-time and planned service alert information for subways, buses, Long Island Rail Road, and Metro-North Railroad. This information is available in GTFS-RT (protocol buffer) and JSON formats.
plan_submission_date_notes: Delayed while determining how to best link to real-time feeds.

dataset_name_title: MTA Staten Island Railway On-Time Performance
description: Measures a variety of operationally critical SIR performance metrics.
Provides customer injury and vehicle collision rates occurring on MTA's services, as reported monthly in agency performance reports.
Contains estimated quarterly fare evasion rates for the subway.
plan_submission_date_notes: Moved back one quarter to give staff additional time to finalize the dataset documentation.

description: Contains estimated quarterly fare evasion rates for the bus.
plan_submission_date_notes: Moved back one quarter to give staff additional time to finalize the dataset documentation.

dataset_name_title: MTA LIRR Lost Time Rates: Beginning 2019
description: Provides the rate of reportable job-related injuries resulting in lost work time, used to monitor and manage workplace safety.
Major Incidents are incidents that delay 50 or more trains, which cause the most disruption to customers.
Service Reliability evaluates LIRR's performance delivering timely and effective service to its customers based on a variety of metrics.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bus Mean Distance Between Failures: Beginning 2015
description: Measures how frequently mechanical problems such as engine failures or electrical malfunctions cause delays in bus service.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway Mean Distance Between Failures: Beginning 2015
description: Measures how frequently car-related problems such as door failures, loss of motor power, or brake issues cause a delay of over five minutes.

dataset_name_title: MTA Staten Island Railway Mean Distance Between Failures
description: Measures a variety of operationally critical SIR performance metrics.

dataset_name_title: MTA LIRR Mean Distance Between Failures: Beginning 2015
description: Represents the average number of miles a rail car travels before a mechanical failure causes the train to arrive at its final destination more than 5 minutes and 59 seconds later than scheduled. This measures the reliability of equipment in revenue service.
Service Delivered measures New York City Transit's ability to deliver the amount scheduled subway service and capacity during peak hours.
Service Delivered measures the percentage of scheduled bus service that is actually provided during peak hours.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway Customer Journey-Focused Metrics: Beginning 2015
description: Measures the quality of the customer experience based on several subway journey-focused metrics, including the estimated average extra time that customers spend waiting on the platform or onboard a train, as well as the estimated percentage of customer trips with a total travel time within five minutes of the scheduled time.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bus Customer Journey-Focused Metrics: Beginning 2017
description: Measures the quality of the customer experience based on several bus journey-focused metrics, including the estimated average extra time that customers spend waiting at a bus stop or onboard a bus, as well as the estimated percentage of customer trips with a total travel time within five minutes of the scheduled time.

dataset_name_title: MTA Staten Island Railway Scheduled Trips
description: Measures a variety of operationally critical SIR performance metrics.
Measures how quickly buses travel along their routes, calculated as a bus’s average end-to-end speed along a route using Bus Time data.
Presents the total number and percentage of LIRR trains that have been canceled, either fully (Canceled) or partially (Terminated).

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway Terminal On-Time Performance: Beginning 2015
description: This dataset reflects a legacy metric that measures the percentage of trains arriving at their destination within five minutes of their scheduled arrival times.
Determines how frequently a commuter train arrives at its final destination within 5 minutes and 59 seconds of its scheduled time, broken down by branch/line, time period, and systemwide metrics.

dataset_name_title: MTA Access-A-Ride Pickup On-Time Performance: Beginning 2016
description: Measures the quality of provider service for pick-ups, comparing actual to promised pick-up time. It is measured on both 15-minute and 30-minute windows.

dataset_name_title: MTA NYCT Paratransit Provider No-Shows: Beginning 2016
description: Measures the frequency with which primary providers do not arrive at the pick-up location within 30 minutes of the promised time and the trip is not provided.

Measures the quality of provider service with two metrics: (1) Ride Time Variance Performance, comparing actual trip durations to planned, and (2) Average Actual Trip Duration, calculating the average duration of all trips in a given grouping.
Measures customer complaints and comments on Access-A-Ride service quality at a rate per 1,000 completed trips.
Measures Access-A-Ride trip results against multiple standards, including Pick-Up On-Time Performance, Drop-Off On-Time Performance, Max Ride Time, and Provider No-Shows.

dataset_name_title: MTA Access-A-Ride Call Center Performance: Beginning 2016
description: Measures the percent of calls that are answered and the average speed with which those calls are answered.
This dataset reflects a legacy metric that measures how regularly subway trains are spaced during peak hours at selected timepoints on each line.
This dataset reflects a legacy metric that measures how evenly buses are spaced.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway Elevator and Escalator Availability: Beginning 2015
description: Represents the percent of the time that elevators and escalators are operational systemwide.

dataset_name_title: MTA LIRR Elevator and Escalator Availability: Beginning 2019
description: Represents the percent of the time that elevators and escalators are operational systemwide.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bus Wheelchair Ramp/Lift Usage: Beginning 2018
description:
Provides the number of wheelchair ramp or lift deployments
on buses each month.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway and Bus Reduced-Fare MetroCard Usage: Beginning 2018
description: Measures the number of subway and bus journeys made each month by passengers using Reduced-Fare MetroCards.
Provides a record of outstanding long-term debt and debt pay down.
Provides farebox recovery ratios, being the percentage of operating budget met by fares collected from customers.
Presents a list of fuel hedge contracts and prices for all MTA agencies.

dataset_name_title: Workforce Positions by Function and Agency - budget and actuals
description: Presents budgeted and actual MTA workforce positions, by job function, type, and agency.
plan_submission_date_notes: Moved back one quarter to finalize a reliable publication pipeline from a new, internal source.

dataset_name_title: Workforce Positions by Function and Occupational Group - budget and actuals
description: Presents budgeted and actual MTA workforce positions, by job function, type, and agency.
plan_submission_date_notes: Moved back one quarter to finalize a reliable publication pipeline from a new, internal source.

description: An element of the MTA Financial Plan, this dataset reflects budgeted revenues and expenses on an accrual basis (at the time revenues or expenditures are committed), by category and for all MTA agencies. The Financial Plan, which looks ahead three years, is proposed in November each year, finalized and allocated to calendar months in February, and revised in July each year.
Provides totals for actual, estimated, and adopted overtime per MTA agency.

dataset_name_title: Cash Basis Statement of Operations - budgeted
description: An element of the MTA Financial Plan, this dataset reflects budgeted revenues and expenses on a cash basis (at the time funds are received or paid out), by category and for all MTA agencies.

dataset_name_title: Statement of Operations - actuals by month
description: An element of the MTA Financial Plan, this dataset reflects actual revenues and expenditures, by month, category, and MTA agency.
Provides statistics on the diversity within MTA's workforce, by race, gender, and job classification.

dataset_name_title: Minority- and women-owned business utilization statistics
description: Provides statistics on the utilization of minority-, women-, and service-dislabled veteran-owned, and disadvantaged businesses in MTA contracts.

Points to the MTA website with complete data and summaries from several large customer travel behavior surveys: LIRR origin-destination survey (2012-2014), Metro-North origin-destination survey (2007 and 2017), and the New York City travel survey (2008 and 2018).
Provides a historical record of the occupancy data provided via MTA's real-time data feeds for NYC buses, Long Island Rail Road, and Metro-North Railroad.
plan_submission_date_notes: Planned submission date moved from Q3 2023 to move up higher priority datasets for release.

description: Provides daily systemwide ridership and traffic figures for all MTA services with a percentage comparison against comparable pre-pandemic data.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway Accessible Station Platform Availability: Beginning 2018
description: Reflects the percentage of time during each month that the average platform at accessible stations is available to passengers who need step-free access.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway and Bus Employee Assaults and Harassments
description: Reflects the weekly number of employee-reported incidents of assault and harassment against on-duty New York City Transit Subway (including Staten Island Railway) and Regional Bus Operations (NYCT Bus and MTA Bus) employees.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bus Passenger Environment Survey: 2015 to 2019
description: Combines the results of surveys of several different aspects of bus vehicle and operating conditions to measure passenger comfort and convenience.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway Car Passenger Environment Survey: 2015 to 2019
description: Combines the results of surveys of several different aspects of subway car conditions to measure passenger comfort and convenience.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway Station Passenger Environment Survey: 2015 to 2019
description: Combines the results of surveys of several different aspects of subway station conditions to measure passenger comfort and convenience.
Reflects the number of train delays per month, broken down into identifiable categories.

dataset_name_title: MTA LIRR Fare Collection Failure Rates: Beginning 2015
description: Reflects the quality of fare collection by LIRR conductors, as observed by MTA Auditors.
Reflects the monthly dollar amount of chargebacks and the percentage of transactions that have been disputed with the customer receiving a refund.

dataset_name_title: MTA Access-A-Ride Drop-off On-Time Performance: Beginning 2016
description: Measures the quality of provider service, comparing actual to customer-requested drop-off time for trips scheduled with an appointment time.

dataset_name_title: MTA NYCT Paratransit Max Ride Time Performance: Beginning 2018
description: Presents the percentage of trips performed within Access-A-Ride’s established max ride time standards.

dataset_name_title: MTA Customer Feedback Performance Metrics: Beginning 2017
description: Presents customer feedback metrics, including total number of customer complaints and commendations and feedback rates per 100,000 riders, for Subway, Bus, Access-A-Ride, MetroCard, and non-service issues. The data covers feedback about New York City Transit operations only at this time.

dataset_name_title: MTA Monthly Ridership / Traffic Data: Beginning January 2008
description: Provides ridership totals for subways, buses, LIRR, and Metro-North on a monthly basis.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bus Mean Distance Between Service Interruptions: Beginning 2015
description: This dataset reflects a monthly legacy service performance metric that indicates how frequently service interruptions cause delays in bus service.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bus Weekday Pull Out Performance: Beginning 2015
description: This dataset reflects a monthly legacy service performance metric that indicates the percent of required buses and operators available in the AM and PM peak periods.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bus System Fleet Age: Beginning 2015
description: Provides the monthly legacy service indicators "System Buses older than 12 years" and "System Fleet Age" that characterize the age of MTA's bus fleet.

Provides MTA's projected ridership and traffic volumes by MTA operating agency coinciding with the current financial plan years, with monthly calendarized levels for the current year, and may be extended in the future to include longer-term projections. Annual ridership and traffic projections are updated in each financial plan, and monthly calanderized projections for the current year are provided in the February Financial Plan for the Adopted Budget and in September for the July Financial Plan. For the period beginning July 2020, the methodology used to project ridership and traffic volumes has been modified to align projections with MTA's pandemic recovery revenue forecasts.
plan_submission_date_notes: Dataset release is delayed while the team develops a reliable way to refresh this dataset.

description: Reflects the total number of registrants for Access-A-Ride service, per time period.
Reflects the number and percentage of subway trains delayed per weekend and weekday based on scheduled service.
Provides a record of actual end-to-end running times, reported in minutes, by subway line, for peak and off-peak time periods.
Provides summary statistics about incidents that cause delay to trains, supporting the Weekday and Weekend Trains Delayed performance metrics.
Provides statistics of violations issued by MTA's bus-mounted Automated Bus Lane Enforcement (ABLE) camera systems.
A tabular representation of the 20-Year Needs as presented in the published document, to the appropriate level of granularity.

Presents leading Roadway Safety indicators, including workforce development, fleet preventative maintenance and safety taskforce inspection numbers, as well as Fire Safety indicators, including total number of fire code audits and FDNY liaison visits.

dataset_name_title: Monthly gas prices and weather conditions
description: Provides information about monthly gas prices and weather conditions as they pertain to Bridges & Tunnels facilities.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bridges & Tunnels Monthly E-ZPass Usage Rates: Beginning 2005
description: Provides information about revenue and collection rates, per month and Bridges & Tunnels facility.

dataset_name_title: MTA Bridges & Tunnels Monthly Traffic Rates: Beginning 2005
description: Provides monthly traffic information, broken down by type of toll media, type of vehicle, time period, and Bridges & Tunnels facility.
Statistics about the type and frequency of service alerts communicated on mta.info, on digital displays, via social media, and/or via email and text message.

dataset_name_title: MTA Customer Engagement Statistics: Beginning May 2017
description: Statistics and performance metrics about the volume and responsiveness in engaging with customers via several customer engagement channels.

dataset_name_title: Transit Adjucation Bureau Subway and Bus violations data
description: Provides statistics on the violations issued and fines paid, as processed by the NYCT Transit Adjudication Bureau (TAB). TAB processes summons issued for violations of one or more of the rules governing conduct in the New York City Transit system.
Provides a list of procurement actions approved by the MTA Board.

dataset_name_title: Incidents of major crime on LIRR
description: Reflects the number of MTA Police Department-reported incidents of select types of criminal activity within the LIRR and Metro-North Railroad systems.

dataset_name_title: LIRR workplace violence, harassment, and assaults involving employees
description: Provides statistics on the frequency of workplace violence assault and harassment against Long Island Rail Road and Metro-North Railroad employees.

dataset_name_title: MTA Subway and Bus Lost Time Accidents
description: The number of reportable job-related incidents that result in the inability of an employee to perform full job duties for at least one working day beyond the day of the incident, as well as a breakdown of the number of Employees and Lost Time Accident Rates.

dataset_name_title: MTA Open Data Catalog and Publication Schedule
description: Provides a list of all currently available MTA datasets on the portal as well as datasets scheduled to be released by quarter.

dataset_name_title: MTA Metro-North Service Delivered: Beginning January 2019
description: Presents the total number and percentage of MNR trains that have been canceled, either fully (Canceled) or partially (Terminated).
